definition: to revise and enlarge (a book)/to augment a purchase order
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: And now, I will update about him.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我將增訂關於他的。

sentences.english: Shi Xiaojing's version is faithful to the revised edition of Lao She's novel.
sentences.chinese: 施曉菁的譯本忠實地對老舍的增訂本進行了翻譯。

sentences.english: Additions giving expression to the loftier and more spiritual theology of a later time.
sentences.chinese: 增訂條文，體現了崇高的精神和更加神學稍後的時間。

sentences.english: The fax copy of the agreement and supplementary agreements thereto shall have legal effect.
sentences.chinese: 本協議的傳真副本和增訂協議具有法律效力。

sentences.english: Thank you for your telex duplicating your order for 400 dozen Marco brand shirts.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝貴公司電傳增訂400打馬爾科牌襯衣。

sentences.english: We usually allow 10% discount for each extra ten thousand yards.
sentences.chinese: 通常我方每增訂一萬碼，增加10%折扣。

sentences.english: However, the second revised edition of the book is not without shortcomings.
sentences.chinese: 當然，增訂二版的語法部分也存在着一些不足之處。

sentences.english: The small pocket dictionary was expanded into a full-sized one.
sentences.chinese: 那部袖珍小詞典經增訂成爲大型詞典。

sentences.english: The new items thus added shall be incorporated in this agreement.
sentences.chinese: 增訂的項目仍應列入本合同範圍之內。

definition: variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
Wu Han (1909-1969), historian, author of biography of Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋, hounded to his death together with several members of his family during the cultural revolution
